It is signed Shinto Minamoto Yoshikuni and dated Kansei 7 (1795), probably
the 3rd-4th generation, lived at Morioka in Mutsu.
Alan

From: "Patrik Danielsson" <patrik.danielsson@...>

Subject: [nihontostudy] Sword has arrive.


Hello to you alla again.

The sword has arrived, it was much better that i thought it would be, the
blade has a lot of dried oil on it , need to get this off in a nice and
smoth way, and i FINALY get the Tsuka off it, i understand why the former
owner didnt want to take it off, the mekugi has been there for a long time.
But anyway i did found Mei on both sides of the Nakago, i have taken 2
pictures of it , more comming on the blade, mountings,and saya, when my
camera are ready again.
Can anyone translate the meiï¿½s on it???
